cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles south of Galveston, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest toward the central Texas coast, then forecast to slow and curl north-northeast skirting the upper Texas coast and Galveston Bay before turning inland toward Louisiana
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Port O'Connor / Matagorda Peninsula, TX

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for the upper Texas coast; watches remain farther south from Baffin Bay to Port Aransas.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Port Aransas, TX to Morgan City, LA; Storm-Surge Warning from Port Aransas, TX to Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge, LA including Galveston Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Middle and upper Texas coast (Port Aransas through Galveston Bay) and southwestern Louisiana coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40-55 mph) likely in the Galveston Bay / Houston Ship Channel beginning Monday afternoon and persisting through early Wednesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–5 ft of inundation possible in Galveston Bay and along the Houston Ship Channel, with large waves on top of the surge.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches of rain with locally higher totals up to 15 inches, producing flash and urban flooding across the Houston metropolitan area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes, dangerous rip currents, rough seas and swell that will disrupt pilot transfers and along-berth operations.
